thread.title: BREAKING: Mark Warburton Denies Resigning Despite Club Statement
thread.title_full: BREAKING: Mark Warburton Denies Resigning Despite Club Statement

title: BREAKING: Mark Warburton Denies Resigning Despite Club Statement
text:
BREAKING: Mark Warburton Denies Resigning Despite Club Statement Fri Feb 10 2017 21:53:48   21:53:48 GMT+0000 (GMT) TheSPORTbible football 
M ark Warburton is said to be confused about reports he's resigned from his post as Rangers manager tonight, claiming he's unaware of any resignation. 
A statement , seemingly from the club, was released via Twitter on Friday evening stating that Warburton, his assistant David Weir and Head of Recruitment Frank McParland has all left the club with immediate effect, and Graeme Murty would take charge of Sunday's Scottish Cup tie against Morton. - Rangers FC (@RangersFC) February 10, 2017 Rangers has accepted the resignations of manager Mark Warburton, assistant David Weir & the Club's head of recruitment Frank McParland. - Rangers FC (@RangersFC) February 10, 2017 BREAKING: Sky sources: Mark Warburton denies resigning as manager of Rangers. More here: https://t.co/JhHtLJuIdN https://t.co/2gIRy3SCCp - Sky Sports News HQ (@SkySportsNewsHQ) February 10, 2017 
However, within minutes of the news breaking, BBC journalist Chris McLaughlin appeared to have spoken to a rather miffed and confused Warburton: Mark Warburton says he's unaware of #Rangers statement regarding his resignation. Says he hasn't resigned. Bizarre. - Chris McLaughlin (@BBCchrismclaug) February 10, 2017 
Moreover, at last check, there is no mention of the news on the home page of Rangers' official website, which only adds to the confusion at this point. 
Has the club's Twitter account been hacked, or has there been a serious case of crossed wires between Warburton and the club's hierarchy? 
What's going on? 
This story was first featured on talkingbaws.com - simple, shareable sport. Like them on Facebook and follow them on Twitter. Sponsored Links
